mdRecord.dcterms:description: Jefferson and Clerisseau collaborated to design the central portion of the modern state capital based on Mason Carree at Nimes in southern France, a temple built by the Romans. Extensively renovated and enlarged 1904-1906 according to composite plans of Frye and Chesterman and Noland and Baskervill, supervised by John Kevan Peebles. Renovations included repairs and construction of hyphens, wings and south stairs. Wings and hyphens designed by Peebles. In 1964, the wing connectors were enlarged to create conference room space. Further renovation, restoration and expansion took place 2003-2007. -- http://virginiacapitol.gov, http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virginia_State_Capitol [work]
